goals.question: What is the frequency of bird strikes per year?
goals.visualization: Line chart of bird strikes per year
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the trend of bird strikes over the years and identify any patterns or anomalies.

goals.question: Which bird species is responsible for the most strikes?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of bird species and their frequency of strikes
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the most common bird species involved in bird strikes and take necessary measures to prevent them.

goals.question: What is the distribution of bird strikes across different airports?
goals.visualization: Map of airports with size of markers indicating frequency of bird strikes
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the airports with the highest frequency of bird strikes and take necessary measures to prevent them.

goals.question: What is the impact of bird strikes on different types of aircraft?
goals.visualization: Stacked bar chart of aircraft types and their frequency of bird strikes
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the impact of bird strikes on different types of aircraft and take necessary measures to prevent them.

goals.question: What is the time of day when bird strikes are most likely to occur?
goals.visualization: Line chart of bird strikes by time of day
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the time of day when bird strikes are most likely to occur and take necessary measures to prevent them.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Incident Year'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Incident Year'], format='%Y', errors='coerce')
    data = data.groupby(data['Incident Year'].dt.year)['Record ID'].count().reset_index()
    plt.plot(data['Incident Year'], data['Record ID'])
    plt.title('What is the frequency of bird strikes per year?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    bird_strikes = data.groupby('Species Name')['Record ID'].count().reset_index()
    bird_strikes = bird_strikes.sort_values(by='Record ID', ascending=False)
    plt.bar(bird_strikes['Species Name'], bird_strikes['Record ID'], color='green')
    plt.xticks(rotation=90)
    plt.title('Which bird species is responsible for the most strikes?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Bird Species')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency of Strikes')
    return plt

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['count'] = 1
    grouped_data = data.groupby(['Airport']).count().reset_index()
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 8))
    ax.scatter(grouped_data['Longitude'], grouped_data['Latitude'], s=grouped_data['count']*10, alpha=0.5)
    ax.set_xlabel('Longitude')
    ax.set_ylabel('Latitude')
    ax.set_title('What is the distribution of bird strikes across different airports?')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Incident Year'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Incident Year'], format='%Y', errors='coerce')
    aircraft_types = data.groupby('Aircraft Type')['Record ID'].count().sort_values(ascending=False)
    chart = aircraft_types.plot(kind='bar', stacked=True, figsize=(10, 6))
    chart.set_xlabel('Aircraft Type')
    chart.set_ylabel('Frequency of Bird Strikes')
    chart.set_title('What is the impact of bird strikes on different types of aircraft?')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Time of Day'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Time of Day'], format='%H:%M', errors='coerce')
    data = data.groupby(data['Time of Day'].dt.hour).size().reset_index(name='counts')
    plt.plot(data['Time of Day'], data['counts'])
    plt.title('What is the time of day when bird strikes are most likely to occur?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Time of Day')
    plt.ylabel('Number of Bird Strikes')
    plt.axvline(data['Time of Day'][data['counts'].idxmax()], color='r', linestyle='--', label='Most Likely Time')
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
